English.string: Controls
Touchpad
Touching the touch pad shoots out an laser pointer
Trigger
Pull and hold the trigger to manipulate objects
Language Selection
Hood
Remove hood
Hood is protecting microscope
Light Switch
Turn on/off the microscope by squeezing trigger
With light switch you turn on light of an micorscope. Light source is usually halogen
Mechanical stage
By moving mechanical stage you can move the sample
Mechanical stage can be moved on x- and z-axis
Sample slide
Pick up sample slide to sample holder. Grap the sample by squeezing and holding the trigger
The sample on sample slide is covered with cover glass
Slide holder
Open and close slide holder by squeezing the trigger
Slide holder holds the slide, holders position can be adjusted on lateral direction
Oculars
Oculars are adjusted for users own eyes, the sample should be seen as one image
In this version it is not possible to look the sample trough the oculars
Light volume control
Grap the control nub by squeezing and holding the trigger and rotate controller to adjust light volume
Lightsource illuminates the sample for it to be seen clearly
Objective revolver
Start focusing with smallest objective (10x)
Rotate the objective revolver by squeezing and holding the trigger while rotating the controller
Objective revolver holds the objectives with different magnifications
Iris diaphgram
Position of iris diaphgram is dependant of the objectices numeral aperture (not implemented)
Position should match with numeral aperture of current objectice
Field diaphgram
Start by closing field diaphgram. Grap the by squeezing and holding the trigger and move controller to left
Open the field diaphgram that the hole screen is in use. Squeez and hold the trigger and move controller to right
Field diaphgram controls width of light column and reduces reflections and scattering improving image quality
Condenser
Condensor is adjusted so that the edges of field diaphgram opening are sharp (not implemented)
Condensor focuses light evenly to the sample. Condensors adjustments effects image contrast and brightness
Centralizing controls
Rotate screws until opening is in middle of the screen. Squeez and hold the trigger while rotating controller
Centralizing controls are used to get the opening in the middle of the field of view
Coarse and fine focus controls
Coarse focus
Squeeze and hold trigger while rotating controller until picture is focused
Coarse focus allows coarse focusing the image
Fine focus
Squeeze and hold trigger while rotating controller until picture is focused and instruction changes
Fine focus allows more accurate focusing control.
Done
Adjusting microscope finished, you can now look this or other samples
